column4: Linux LiveCDs can be read in Windows as data folders [assuming they're formatted in FAT32 or some other readable fs], right?
if it's a liveusb, yes. cds arent fat32
what's the difference between windows i386 and linux i686?
it is a USB drive, yes.  I was looking for a way to have a bootable LiveCD and some other Windows utilities at the same time, and XP apparently doesn't like the idea of partitioning a USB drive
